c2c4518c-5469-45a2-bc9d-74a2e093c021.description: Students who complete this certificate understand the roles and responsibilities of a technical writer and can plan and deliver technical communications. They are able to apply, test and measures the principles of usability and analyze draft technical communications for deliverables and revise contents.
c2c4518c-5469-45a2-bc9d-74a2e093c021.name: Technical Writing

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: Topics include technical writing, usability and readability, e-sign and layout, publishing and an introduction to HTML and XML.

2cfa3b8a-65cf-43ca-a33d-a677503a7517.description: Student develop critical skills around the User Experience stack for a solid foundation in user-focused design best practices and information architecture.
2cfa3b8a-65cf-43ca-a33d-a677503a7517.name: User Experience Design

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: Students complete over 190 hours of instruction.  Courses include:  Design Principles; HTML and CSS - Levels 1 and 2; Responsive Web Design, UX - Design Fundamentals; User Experience Research; UX - Information Architecture; UX - Interaction Design; Graphic Design Basics; Developing Web Content; UX - Usability Studies; and UX - Design Certificate Capstone.

09a95908-06bc-4352-b55a-5b011c8ebd72.description: This program focuses on the skills and competencies for today's industry needs. Curriculum is based upon the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK©) Guide and prepares students for the Project Management Professional (PMP®) Exam. The Tombolo Institute is a PMI Registered Education Provider.
09a95908-06bc-4352-b55a-5b011c8ebd72.name: Project Management

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: This certificate requires completion of over 150 hours of instruction and 11 required courses to prepare students for a career in project management and the PMP® Exam.

0ecc838d-5914-4449-8bfb-4ecacb16d1a1.description: The Translation - 100 Level Series is composed of 5 courses totaling 15 credits. Participants engage in hands-on activities to explore real-world best practices to facilitate the communication between speakers of different languages in the written and spoken medium. Core courses provide fundamental interpreting and translation skills to speakers of any language.
0ecc838d-5914-4449-8bfb-4ecacb16d1a1.name: Translation - 100 Level Series

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

alignments.name: Translation 100 Level course completion
alignments.description: Completion of all 100 level courses within the Translation Certificate program, or 15 of 24 credits. Core courses provide fundamental interpreting and translation related skills to speakers of any language, covering general theory and practical skills necessary for performing entry-level professional interpretation in a variety of settings.

alignments.name: Course 1: Introduction to Translation and Interpreting (3 credits)
alignments.description: Introduction to translating and interpreting as a career, and for those who work with translators and interpreters. Overview of the field and skill necessary for the profession. Covers general problems involved in translating and interpreting.

alignments.name: Course 2: Fundamentals of Translation (3 credits)
alignments.description: Learn basic translation techniques & the process of translation. Includes a practical review of the English writing, editing and proofreading skills necessary to produce clear, polished translations. Understand the differences in propositional, expressive, presupposed, and evoked meaning. Conduct effective terminology and content research.

alignments.name: Course 3: Technology for Translators & Interpreters (3 credits)
alignments.description: Introduction to equipment & electronic tools used by professional translators and interpreters throughout their workflow. Develop basic skills using, assessing and choosing appropriate hardware & software including computer-assisted translation tools.

alignments.name: Course 4: Terminology Management & Research (3 credits)
alignments.description: Develop skills terminology research, dictionary usage & glossary building. Basic terminology in medicine, law computers, business & international trade are covered. Understanding meaning of Triangle Model, Object Categorization, Classification of Concepts, Generic & Partitive Hierarchical Relationships and Non-Intrinsic Relationships.

alignments.name: Course 5: Ethics and Business Practice of Translation & Interpretation (3 credits)
alignments.description: Learnt he role of the interpreter & translator in the business conference, medical & courtroom setting. Familiarization with current business practices (determining feeds and negotiating contracts). Demonstrate understanding of the Code of Ethics for Translators, the Code of Ethics for Interpreters, and the ASL Ethics and Code Conduct.

badge_template_activities.title: The bearer of this Translation & Interpretation 100 Level completion has met or exceeded satisfactory achievement of certificate-100 level and course-level competencies. They participated in hands-on learning exercises, applied projects and other instructor assessed activities to demonstrate translation and interpreting skills and knowledge.

7294c4e4-7bf3-4ff5-a012-9a6c13880357.description: Students completing this certificate develop professional level photography skills. With over 190 course hours, this course develops students abilities for both online and print displays of their work. Course work includes Adobe Lightroom, Digital Photography, Telling Better Stories, Photographic Portraiture, the Business of Art, and other courses and finishes with a Photography Portfolio Review.
7294c4e4-7bf3-4ff5-a012-9a6c13880357.name: Digital Photography

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: Expert use of digital camera; Photo Composition; Lighting; Digital Editing; Photography as a storytelling medium; business skills relevant to selling photographs and freelance work.

168673a6-3e5c-4563-9b35-2e22584e105b.description: This certificate prepares students for the Human Resources credentialing examination and focuses on HR fundamentals, compensation and benefit basics, employment law, HR systems and metrics, performance management and employee relations, recruiting and retaining talent, communication, ethics and project management.
168673a6-3e5c-4563-9b35-2e22584e105b.name: Human Resources Management

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: Define and understand the essential roles and responsibilities of human resource professionals.  Students explain and apply strategies to manage employee relations, compensation and performance management, recognize and assess human resource-related laws and compliance and liability issues and develop strategies for recruiting the best employees as well as training and developing them.

3b44456e-07cd-49a2-9d85-a53d12f8de3a.description: The Software Test Engineer Certificate is designed to qualify students for jobs as entry level software testers.
3b44456e-07cd-49a2-9d85-a53d12f8de3a.name: Software Test Engineer

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must successfully complete the following courses to qualify for this badge.  Principles of Software Testing, Professional Testing Methods, Test Planning, Modeling and Reporting, Structured Query Language:  Level 1, C# Programming: 1, C# Programming: 2, C# Automation and the Software Test Engineer Certificate Capstone.

2a48b50d-3656-4ab9-a9f2-037b1f648f69.description: With a foundation of design principles, courses focus on pre-press skills and the use of computer-based tools for page layouts, as well as digital image creation and enhancement. This certificate includes sixteen courses which focus on a combination of skills that range from key concepts, terminology and principles to user experience design skills and coding.
2a48b50d-3656-4ab9-a9f2-037b1f648f69.name: Graphic Design

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: Discover the foundations of design through key concepts, terminology and principles.  Development of visual design and UX design skills.  Design portfolio principles and practices for print and digital production.  Application of graphic design skills through capstone project.

skills.name: User Experience, UX, UI, Design Thinking

126b745f-8731-4ffb-b945-6c4a110491a0.description: With a foundation in design principles, courses focus on skills that are directly transferable to the workplace. This certificate includes twelve courses which focus on a combination of skills that range from key concepts, terminology and principles to user experience design skills, coding, and web accessibility.
126b745f-8731-4ffb-b945-6c4a110491a0.name: Web Design

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: Students successfully complete the following courses, Design Principles, User Experience (UX) - Design Fundamentals, HTML and CSS:  Levels 1 and 2, Design Tools, Responsive Web Design, Photoshop CC:  Level 1, Search Engine Optimization, Web Accessibility, Scripting for Web Designers, jQuery Fundamentals, and completes with a capstone course which allows students to integrate all of the concepts learned throughout the program.

skills.name: User Experience, UX, UI, Design Thinking

f10ed133-3d29-4688-a283-1de4217c3d43.description: The Translation and Interpretation 100 Level Completion is composed of six courses totaling 18 credits. Participants engage in hands on activities to explore real world best practices to facilitate the communication between speakers of different languages in the written and spoken medium. Core course provide fundamental interpreting and translation skills to speaker of any language.
f10ed133-3d29-4688-a283-1de4217c3d43.name: Translation & Interpretation - 100 Level

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

alignments.name: Translation and Interpretation 100 Level Course Completion
alignments.description: Completion of all 100 level courses in the Translation and Interpretation Certificate program, or 18 of 36 credits. These core courses provide fundamental interpreting & translation related skills to speakers of any language, covering general theory and practical skills necessary for entry-level professional interpretation in a variety of settings.

alignments.name: Course 1: Introduction to Translation and Interpreting (3 credits)
alignments.description: Introduction to translating and interpreting as a career, and for those who work with translators and interpreters. Overview of the field and skill necessary for the profession. Covers general problems involved in translating and interpreting.

alignments.name: Course 2: Fundamentals of Translation (3 credits)
alignments.description: Covers the building blocks of interpreting, including analyzing, summarizing and paraphrasing, listening comprehension, shadowing, closure & note taking. Understand the dynamics of interpretation, know the principles & practices of sight translation, consecutive interpretation & simultaneous interpretation.

alignments.name: Course 3: Fundamentals of Translation (3 credits)
alignments.description: Learn basic translation techniques & the process of translation. Includes a practical review of the English writing, editing, and proofreading skills necessary to produce clear, polished translations. Understand the differences in propositional, expressive, presupposed and evoked meaning. Conduct effective terminology & content research.

alignments.name: Course 4: Technology for Translators & Interpreters (3 credits)
alignments.description: Introduction to equipment & electronic tools used by professional translators and interpreters throughout their workflow. Develop basic skills using, assessing a& choosing appropriate hardware & software including computer-assisted translation tools.

alignments.name: Course 5: Terminology Management & Research (3 credits)
alignments.description: Develop skills terminology research, dictionary usage & glossary building. Basic terminology in medicine, law computers, business & international trade are covered. Understand meaning of the Triangle Model, Object Categorization, Classification of Concepts, Generic & Partitive Hierarchical Relationships, & Non-Intrinsic Relationships.

alignments.name: Course 6: Ethics and Business Practice of Translation & Interpretation (3 credits)
alignments.description: Learn the role of the interpreter & translator in the business conference, medical & courtroom setting. Familiarization with current business practices (determining feeds and negotiating contracts). Demonstrate understanding of the Code of Ethics for Translators, the Code of Ethics for Interpreters, and the ASL Ethics and Code of Conduct.

badge_template_activities.title: The bearer of this Translation & Interpretation 100 Level completion has met or exceeded satisfactory achievement of certificate 100 level and course level competencies. The participated in hands-on learning exercises, applied projects, and other instructor assessed activities to demonstrate translation and interpreting skills and knowledge.

d75250e8-cd21-488c-97ac-86798f55f51d.description: Students will develop skills in designing and writing C# computer programs. Students must successfully complete the following courses to qualify for this badge. C# Programming: 1; C# Programming: 2; C# Programming: 3; C# Programming: 4; Algorithms in. NET; Data Access Using C#; C# Programming Certificate Capstone.
d75250e8-cd21-488c-97ac-86798f55f51d.name: C# Programming

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: Designing and writing C# computer programs; Understand basic concepts of the .NET Framework; Handle data structures, storage techniques, exception handling, strings, regular expressions and collections; Use C# and software components such as ADO to access data and data services.

f0c34735-c6c9-4621-b39d-20d9372174cf.description: Students completing this certificate use data to design, create and integrate reports using SQL databases to enhance data organization and report generation. This program teaches students to extract, combine and clean up data to prepare it for analysis.
f0c34735-c6c9-4621-b39d-20d9372174cf.name: Database Business Intelligence Developer

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: Completed nine courses with over 200 hours of instruction.  Structured Query Language:  Level 1; Database Design; Beginning SQL Server; Structured Query Language (T-SQL):  Level 2; T-SQL Programming; SQL Server Analysis Services: SQL Server Integration Services; SQL Server Reporting Services; Database Business Intelligence Developer Certificate Capstone.

3ac3ec7a-1239-4d86-98f5-c6d315d376ff.description: This course provides participants with in-depth professional training that enables students to thrive in healthcare careers. Students will enhance their workplace knowledge and teamwork skills to be appropriate in environmental services and patient sitter roles and be supported in efforts to gain and thrive in careers at hospitals and clinics.
3ac3ec7a-1239-4d86-98f5-c6d315d376ff.name: Healthcare Workplace Foundations

issuer.summary: issued by Tombolo Institute at Bellevue College

badge_template_activities.title: Learning Outcomes include: Applying best practices to team dynamics within the healthcare workplace; Demonstrate effective communication skills to engage with patients, visitors, team members and supervisors; Demonstrate personal styles and behaviors that fit within the healthcare workplace; Articulate relevant skills and past work experiences to present to employers; Contrast between cultural competency and cultural humility and apply various dimensions to workplace dynamics.
